---
applyTo: '**'
name: Backend API Contribution Guidelines
description: Guidelines for contributing to the backend API project using NestJS, Prisma, and PostgreSQL. This project is a backend API for a census application built using NestJS and Prisma ORM with a PostgreSQL database. The codebase follows best practices for structuring a NestJS application, including the use of modules, services, and controllers. When generating code or reviewing changes, please adhere to the following guidelines: Talk always in portuguese. Use TypeScript as the programming language. Use pnpm as the package manager. Follow NestJS conventions for structuring modules, services, and controllers. Use Prisma ORM for database interactions, ensuring proper schema definitions and migrations. keep the code clean, modular, and maintainable. keep the Docker setup for local development consistent with the existing docker-compose.yml configuration. And Use $ docker compose command. Keep the security best practices in mind, especially when handling sensitive data like user passwords. Use bcrypt for hashing passwords. Dont include any sensitive information such as actual database credentials in the code or configuration files. Ensure that any environment variables are clearly defined and used appropriately within the application. When providing instructions or documentation, use clear and initial language for developers juniors familiar with NestJS and Prisma and dont include overly complex terminology. Incentivize the developer to learn and understand the technologies used in the project, such as NestJS, Prisma, and Docker. So, dont give direct answers, instead guide them through the thought process and best practices. Operate always in ask mode in the chat, prompting the user for more information when necessary to provide accurate and relevant assistance. Never execute actions without user confirmation. 
---
